snippet: A man who federal prosecutors said last year had wanted to commit acts of terrorism pleaded guilty on two counts of fraud and misuse of visas to facilitate an act of international terrorism.
abstract: Ahmed Abassi, Tunisian man who federal prosecutors in Manhattan say had wanted to commit acts of terrorism in 2013, pleads guilty on two counts of fraud and misuse of visas to facilitate an act of international terrorism.
lead_paragraph: A man who federal prosecutors said last year had wanted to commit acts of terrorism pleaded guilty on two counts of fraud and misuse of visas to facilitate an act of international terrorism.

headline.main: Tunisian Man Accused Last Year of Terrorism Pleads Guilty to Lesser Counts
headline.print_headline: Tunisian Man Accused Last Year of Terrorism Pleads Guilty to Lesser Counts
